feature: Create README.md with project overview and setup instructions
description: The repository has no README.md file, which is the primary entry point for anyone viewing the project on GitHub. This is critical for a portfolio site targeting AI company recruiters who may check GitHub presence.
summary: Add a professional README.md to establish clear project documentation for a personal portfolio site targeting AI company recruiters. The README will explain the site's purpose, technologies used, local development setup, and deployment workflow.

phases.name: Research & Structure
phases.description: Analyze existing codebase and define README sections

subtasks.title: Define README structure and sections
subtasks.description: Based on codebase analysis, determine the optimal structure for the README including: project overview, tech stack, setup instructions, deployment, and project structure sections
subtasks.notes: Analyzed codebase and defined optimal README structure with 10 sections: Header, Overview, Tech Stack, Features, Project Structure, Local Development, Deployment, Development Notes, License, and Author/Contact. Structure documented in build-progress.txt with rationale.

subtasks.title: Create README.md with project header and overview
subtasks.description: Write the README header with project title, brief description, and badges (if applicable). Include overview section explaining this is a personal portfolio site for Abe Diaz, targeting AI company recruiters at Anthropic, OpenAI, and DeepMind.
subtasks.notes: Created README.md with professional header and overview section. Includes project title, tagline, badges (live site + GitHub Pages), comprehensive overview explaining the site's purpose as a personal portfolio targeting AI company recruiters, and key highlights section. All acceptance criteria met: clear project title and description, professional overview explaining site purpose, and live site URL (abediaz.ai) included.

subtasks.title: Add tech stack section
subtasks.description: Document the technologies used: static HTML/CSS, Oswald Google Font, responsive design, GitHub Pages hosting, and GitHub Actions CI/CD.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added comprehensive tech stack section to README.md documenting all required technologies: Static HTML/CSS (single-file architecture), Oswald Google Font, responsive design (with mobile/tablet/desktop breakpoints), GitHub Pages hosting, and GitHub Actions CI/CD. Included detailed explanations of design choices with a "Design Philosophy" section explaining the benefits of the minimalist static approach (performance, security, cost, simplicity, accessibility). All acceptance criteria met: all technologies clearly listed and brief explanation of design choices provided.

subtasks.title: Add local development section
subtasks.description: Document how to clone the repository and run the site locally. Since this is a static site, explain options like opening index.html directly or using a simple local server.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added comprehensive Local Development section to README.md documenting how to clone and run the site locally. Includes clear clone instructions (both HTTPS and SSH), four different local server options (Direct File Access, Python HTTP Server, Node.js HTTP Server, VS Code Live Server), prerequisites listing, and a "Making Changes" section explaining the simple edit-and-refresh workflow. All acceptance criteria met: clear clone instructions, local server options documented, and prerequisites listed. The section emphasizes the simplicity of working with a static site that requires no build process.

subtasks.title: Add deployment section
subtasks.description: Document the GitHub Pages deployment workflow, including how the GitHub Actions pipeline works and how the custom domain (abediaz.ai) is configured.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added comprehensive Deployment section to README.md documenting the GitHub Pages deployment workflow. Includes detailed explanation of the GitHub Actions pipeline (build and deploy jobs), deployment triggers (push to main and manual workflow_dispatch), custom domain configuration (CNAME file + DNS setup), deployment permissions, concurrency control, monitoring instructions, and manual deployment steps. All acceptance criteria met: deployment process clearly explained, GitHub Actions workflow referenced with direct link to deploy.yml, and custom domain configuration (abediaz.ai) thoroughly documented. The section provides a complete understanding of how the automated CI/CD pipeline works from code push to live deployment.

subtasks.title: Add project structure section
subtasks.description: Document the project's file structure including index.html, images folder, CNAME, GitHub workflows, and docs folder.
acceptance_criteria: All key files and directories documented
subtasks.notes: Successfully added comprehensive Project Structure section to README.md documenting all key files and directories. Includes detailed file tree visualization showing index.html, CNAME, images/, docs/, and .github/workflows/ with clear explanations of each component's purpose. Added descriptions of: index.html as self-contained single-file architecture (~16 KB), CNAME for custom domain configuration, images/ folder with profile.jpg and flight-stats.png assets, docs/ folder containing abe-diaz-profile.md, and .github/workflows/ containing deploy.yml CI/CD pipeline. Also included a "What's NOT in this repository" section emphasizing the minimalist approach (no build tools, dependencies, frameworks, preprocessors, or backend). All acceptance criteria met: all key files and directories documented, and purpose of each file/folder clearly explained. Follows the established pattern and tone of previous README sections.

subtasks.title: Add license and contact sections
subtasks.description: Add license information and contact/social links for the site owner to complete the README.
subtasks.notes: Successfully added comprehensive License and Author & Contact sections to complete the README. License section includes full MIT License text with copyright notice and clear distinction between code license (MIT) and personal content rights (© 2025 Abe Diaz). Author & Contact section includes professional header with current role, visual badge-style social links (LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, GitHub), and additional text-based links for accessibility. All acceptance criteria met: license clearly stated, contact links included, and README is complete and professional. The README now provides comprehensive documentation covering all aspects: project overview, tech stack, local development, deployment, project structure, license, and contact information - demonstrating professional technical writing suitable for a portfolio targeting AI company recruiters.

subtasks.title: Review README for completeness and formatting
subtasks.description: Verify the README is well-formatted, all links work, and content is clear and professional. Ensure it reflects well on the site owner as a technical portfolio piece.
subtasks.notes: Successfully validated and fixed the README. Critical issues corrected: (1) Rewrote Deployment section to accurately reflect static site deployment with no build process, (2) Moved Overview section to top for better logical flow, (3) Fixed clone URLs from incorrect username 'abediaz' to correct 'abe238', (4) Eliminated contradictions about npm/build vs static site. All acceptance criteria met: Markdown renders correctly, no broken links, professional tone throughout, demonstrates technical communication skills, content is factually accurate. README now provides comprehensive, accurate documentation suitable for a technical portfolio targeting AI company recruiters.
